definition: to feel the pulse/to take sb's pulse
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)

sentences.english: Let me feel her pulse, and take her temperature.
sentences.chinese: 我来给她把脉和量体温。

sentences.english: The doctor felt the pulse carefully.
Could you feel my pulse and see if I'm all right?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮我把把脉，看看我是否正常吗？

sentences.english: He feels my pulse and sees my tongue.
sentences.chinese: 他先给我把脉，又看我的舌头。

sentences.english: They were headed home to hear a new president diagnose the state of America.
sentences.chinese: 他们赶着回家听一位新总统为美国听诊把脉。

sentences.english: Can you spare not me a less hours the despitenoon?
sentences.chinese: 能把把脉的具体时间安排得尽量早一些好吗？

definition: to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
(TCM) interrogation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
(TCM) diagnosis based on the patient's pulse/to make such a diagnosis
to apply a treatment/to undertake a therapy
acupuncture and moxibustion/to give or have acupuncture and moxibustion
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
